intro: Hulsea vestita, commonly known as the naked hulsea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Crambeae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Hulsea vestita typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
